info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 21 at 9:12PM PST until December 22 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT MST /11 PM PST/ TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Southeast California and far southwest Arizona * WHEN...From midnight MST /11 PM PST/ tonight through Friday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Widespread rainfall with isolated thunderstorms will occur Friday. Moderate rainfall can be expected at times with total rainfall amounts averaging between 0.75" to 1.25" across the Watch area with locally higher amounts in thunderstorm. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
